definition: (phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc

sentences.english: I wanted to write a song that kept eating it's own end rhyming tail.
sentences.chinese: 当时我是想写一首能够跟得上它自己韵尾的歌曲。

sentences.english: This thesis is a sociolinguistic study of Mandarin nasal variation.
sentences.chinese: 论文是一项关于北方话鼻韵尾变异的社会语言学研究。

definition: main vowel in diphthong
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
consonant
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
(Chinese linguistics) zero initial (the initial of a syllable that does not begin with a consonant)
vowel
plosive/stop consonant
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
diphthong
vowel
voiced consonant (linguistics)
leading vowel of diphthong
affricate (phonetics)
simple finals
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
